metadata.Title: CVE-2020-29565 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in OpenStack Horizon before 15.3.2, 16.x before16.2.1, 17.x and 18.x before 18.3.3, 18.4.x, and 18.5.x. There is a lack ofvalidation of the "next" parameter, which would allow someone to supply amalicious URL in Horizon that can cause an automatic redirect to theprovided malicious URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openstack-dashboard - 3:13.0.3-0ubuntu2
openstack-dashboard-ubuntu-theme - 3:13.0.3-0ubuntu2
python-django-horizon - 3:13.0.3-0ubuntu2
python-django-openstack-auth - 3:13.0.3-0ubuntu2
python3-django-openstack-auth - 3:13.0.3-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: horizon package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3:13.0.3-0ubuntu2').
